events.message: The customer reported a rear-end collision involving their car on the highway during morning rush hour.
Initial review categorised the claim under Auto Accident due to the nature of the incident described.
A claims agent specializing in auto cases was assigned to handle this vehicle collision claim.
The customer was notified that their auto accident claim has been received and is being processed.
Request sent for police report, photos of damage, and repair estimates related to the vehicle collision.
Customer provided all requested documents, including detailed photographs and official accident report.
Claims investigator began examining submitted evidence to determine fault and damage extent.
Investigation concluded with confirmation of liability and damage assessment to the customer’s vehicle.
A settlement offer was presented to the customer covering repair costs and rental reimbursement.
The customer responded positively to the proposed settlement amount and expressed satisfaction.
Claim approval was granted following the customer’s acceptance of the settlement terms.
Payment for vehicle repairs and associated costs was issued to the customer promptly.
The claim case was officially closed after confirmation that repairs were completed satisfactorily.
All claim records and correspondence related to the auto accident were archived for future reference.
